info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 6 at 8:16PM CDT until May 8 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
South Sulphur River Near Cooper affecting Delta and Hopkins Counties.
Trinity River Near Long Lake (Oakwood) affecting Anderson, Freestone and Leon Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County.
Trinity River At Dallas affecting Dallas County.
West Fork Trinity River Near Boyd affecting Wise County.
Trinity River At Trinidad affecting Henderson and Navarro Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...South Sulphur River near Cooper.
* WHEN...Until early Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Moderate out of bank flooding will occur along the river reach. A few rural roads will be flooded. Moderate flooding will occur on farm and ranch land adjacent to the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 13.7 feet early Sunday afternoon.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING
